Title: Dont Join If you want Process Horizontal Team Culture
Pro: Good Salary Leaves Good benefits You can take risk for money but dont expect process and culture at least at ITT department
Con: Worked with ITT Forget Analysis there wont be proper Requirement Gathering Things keep on changing and brings lot of uncertainty Poor quality code and practices is very prevalent One side communication from Singapore no feedback or suggestions considered from INDIA Hyderabad They expect only Yes and Understand words Toxic Culture Some of the guys who are with DBS for sometime are behaving the same as Singapore Folks very insecure to share knowledge and responsibilities They create a unnecessary hierarchy with in teams My Voice Survey which impacts Manager hike is a sham Totally rigged and you will be called out if your feedback is not in favour of them BTW it should be Anonymous They compare on par to Google Amazon etc but not even close to most of the service based Final word Join this if you are ok to face politics and toxic culture If you had a good experience with US UK the big MNC culture then SG culture is a big NO

Pro: Working in Human Resources I have a good view of what DBS seeks to do for employees The awareness of diverse employee needs at different life stages and hence policies becoming more flexible and equitable is encouraging to see Grateful for a good culture nurtured by my team leader who cultivates psychological safety and encourages our learning and growth I also believe that DBS is going in the right direction bringing together staff with different expertise to collaborate and manage customer journeys from a holistic view instead of working in silos The work is purposeful and the longer Ive been here the more I feel that DBS has good values is sincere about social impact and is building for a sustainable future
Con: As a large organisation DBS inevitably has many processes and systems to navigate To the banks credit there are many guides that have been written up to help staff navigate these and chatbots to assist but sometimes it can still be hard to find an answer independently Will need to count on colleagues to take time to help andd teach

Title: Company Review
Pro: Stable Job with good bonus ranging for 25months for junior employees AVP and below and up to 35months for senior employees VP Bonus highly dependent on your pay higher your pay lower bonus in terms of months Good for retirement when pay does not really matter
Con: 1 Not recommended for junior employees as junior employees AVP below need to take on additional projects to promote while senior employees VP need not 2 Very low increment 2 for non promotion years when salary is 67k and 47 for promotion due to low benchmark set for ranks but is compensated for high bonus 3 Any cash given out or off cycle adjustments will be taken into account in next years bonusincrement ie No increment in 2021 due to less than ideal business performance but was subsequently given a mid year adjustment due to business recovering Mentioned was due to no increment during bonus earlier in the year However in 2022 bonus and increment cycle mentioned that mid year adjustment was given resulting in lowerno increments 4 Part of bonus paid out in shares which will be paid on the 3rd4th5th year from when the shares were issued Part of the companys tactic as career hostage as these are given out to good performers knowing that people junior employees might leave for better increments 5 Management seem to emphasize on employee survey but takes ages to even try to improve Most improvements are reactive measures 6 Long hours 7 Generally more concern with senior employees than junior VPs vs AVP and below

Title: Toxic company Stay away at all costs
Pro: 1 Benifits like leaves cab facility 2 Support during COVID like extra leaves for the employees
Con: 1 Very Toxic work culture This is the SIngapore working style If you have never worked with Singapore companies before and always worked for USEurope companies in your past avoid DBS at all costs You cant fit in well and will start looking outside within 4 months 2 Pushing the employees to come back to office at any costs 3 No proper Software Development life cycle You as a developer is responsible for architecture design code test and deploy If you are hard worker the entire work will be on you 4 Business dont understand the technicals and they dont care about the time it takes to complete the tasks They simply demand the developers to complete in fixed time and we are bound to complete without any other option 5 Culture is broken Most of us wont fit in 6 People are leaving like crazy because of all these issues Think thrice before joining

Title: Bad Culture Double Standard
Pro: Good for resume Decent pay Good mobile app

Title: Good leaders are hard to find or eroded by the system
Pro: Good benefits supportive peers a good internal network for skill upgrading and lots of programmes to engage employees
Con: Terrible worklife balance The manager leading the team is super lost nickname lost lamb has no clue what is going on often wasting everyones time on meaningless endeavours that has no value KPI and numbers fall from the sky no real justification anywhere This manager is terribly unequipped to lead miscommunication and misdirection rampant zero to negative value addition Dont know who assigned him as manager the PhD like for show only data related question also dont know Epic and speechless Worst is the ethics distorting facts inflating results sabotaging and scapegoating behaviour mostly to tear others down and exalt No wonder no one wants to work in banks and not surprise that my team has 78 resignations in 2021 alone ever since this manager took over in 2020 The number will most probably increase Yet this manager claims its bumpy period so bumpy that new joiners after 1 month resign Nobody wants to work in this team does not resonate with DBS PRIDE values at all GG

Title: Dont ruin your life
Pro: No pros at all things only look good here from far away youll notice reality is different once you join
Con: 1 I have been working at DBS for the past couple of years I have nothing but regrets as I was abused both physically and mentally by manager 2 I got treated like a slave rather than an employee I feel so helpless in these tough covid times where switching jobs is difficult 3 My manager scolded me in front of everyone for one hour and humiliated me for something that wasnt even my fault how am I supposed to deliver when the business analyst has no idea about requirements themselves This used to happen before work from home as well my manager grabbed my collar and pushed me while scolding me 4 Please dont join this company I have no other reason to write this review than to create awareness dont be fooled by the salary they offer are you willing to sacrifice your reputation and respect Are you willing to become a slave you gets abused every two weeks Thin twice before you join I would recommend to join a lesser paying job with good work life balance and where employees are not treated like slaves I sacrificed my honor and respect for money dont follow what I did even if one person benefits from my warning I will consider it worth my effort

Title: Toxic place Zero work life balance
Pro: Benefits but they are shadowed by cons
Con: 1There is no planning for anything neither projects nor people’s career 2Requirements are not clear to product managers even till it’s ready for prod deployment I have experienced a project release which got reverted on user testing day in prod 3 Most laughable thing Mangers think and say that agile means we will it have requirements on day 1 we need to ask questions document the info So When should basic requirement analysis be done After pushing developers to start Dev Whose responsibility is this Well in most of DBS Ibgt teams it’s developer’s responsibility to get requirements etc etc 4 People’s career is joke to them it goes like there is a requirement and oh here is a person who looks free just give it to him Does it match his career goals Does he have knowledge on it Does he need to learn and deliver Nothing is thought of and deadlines are set without considering anything just a random date when user needs that’s it 5 Employees are expected to work any number of hours and even after that they are not given enough support when needed Thankless culture 6 No pay balance at all 7 Just a brain draining and stupid place to work at 8 To top it all HR ppl are of no use than sending out mails about policy changes this benefit that benefit wellness etc etc and in real nothing changes

Con: Room for improvement in implementation and tracking of quantifying success in an unbiased manner

Title: Politics lies and ridiculous expectations
Pro: Pros Good Development team Relatively good extra benefits
Con: 1 Poor upper management planning when it comes to tech projects Basically whatever they want they just open their mouth and expect you to finish it with a random deadline based on how they feel They will overcommit to a deadline without listening to the development teams advice and without any consideration of the current workload and manpower available for the task Goals product features and objectives shifts Eg in sprint 1 the goal was to get Model A working But at the end of sprint 1 Management suddenly expects Model A B and C to work Upper management expects developers to make up for their poor planning and management skills in the form of working on Sundays and Saturdays till 2 am Result Engineers are overworked underappreciated and management only provides lip service with no compensation And yes we have worked Sat and Sundays for 3 weeks in a row 2 Poor pay Politics and lies Pay is not adjusted to the market rate Despite getting external concrete offers management lied about trying to increase the pay rate to match Management only provides lip service without even actually speaking with HR etc They provide excuses like not having enough budget then immediately hire 2 3 more junior engineers whom I have to train and are less qualified but with a better salaray Upper management only rewards those who talk and demand a lot not those who actually do the work Results creates a lot of distrust between employees and management Causes a lot of fiction and distrust between colleagues as everyone is fighting to be heard Also encourages solo work to be done than collaborative work 3 Upper management hires managers that are unskilled in terms of soft skills and hard skills This causes a lot of issues between upper management middle management and developers Middle management would present things and deadlines to upper management with no regard for developers Everyone is just focused on what they want

Title: Horribly Overwork Employee
Pro: NAME
Con: 1 Assign heavy workload and expect things to be delivered within a short of time Not because you have problem with time management it is mainly because of understaff meeting schedule too packed more work piling up everyday and work delay due to data source issues 2 Long working hour because of workload too much and need to spend extra hours to do all the unnecessary trouble shooting thanks to the poor data migration process 3 No work life balance Not only you your boss and your colleagues are all insanely hardworking Its normal to work until 34am during Weekday You thought you can take a break during Weekends Annual Leave and Sick Leave No way You are entitled with 24days annual leave but believe me you will never use it for leisure purposes 4 Nobody will care about your mental health and physical health All they care is donation and support volunteering work outside of the company So that branding can be promoted 5 High expectation from management and bosses your works will never be appreciated 6 Employee TurnOver Rate is increasing More and more people are leaving the company at least 23 people you know will be leaving every month 7 Meeting cultures are bad and some meetings are useless You will spend one whole day to attend meeting because most of the meetings last for at least 1hourand some meetings are only 10 relevant to you or for your updateknowledge sharing only 8 No time to do all those free courses no time to do team bonding no time to do small talk with your colleagues 9 Bad planning and a lot of old problems need to clear Some items have been pending for years or months but nobody do it until you take the ownership 10 People are not very helpful because they are too busy with their own work and clearing backlog When you need help the only way is to ping the person multiple times or escalate through emails cc hisher boss

Title: DAH2 is a great organization to start career with
Pro: Pay is better than most companies Manager and upper management supported immensely when I was going through personal issues loss of loved ones in family Good WFH options during the pandemic as I am able to do 100 of my work from home never had to go to office since the last one year Excellent increment company rewards loyal employees Work load mostly manageable Some use cases are very fun to work in analytics Good hackathon and data focus and frequent contests with rewards Free transport and coffee if you come to office reimbursable internet bills if you are working from home Good coding culture Some colleagues are brilliant in coding you can learn a lot from them Insurance policy is great got cashless claim on a surgery and it covered everything except a few antibiotics Separate flexible benefits that can be used for dental gym membership etc Was able to get WFH office setup via the extra amount provided for pandemic related expenditure CTC documents are very transparent no misleading options to inflate CTC Good gifts given by the company to employees Good training and focus on learning and development Mandatory block leave for all employees very useful to relax
Con: It is a bank so there are some restrictions on the work laptop and VPN so you dont have a lot of freedom there Deployment and release process is a bit problematic but they are working on streamlining it its much better than it was last year Sometimes have to work late or on weekends However they are trying to reduce this and provide compensatory leave if you work on a holiday

Title: Horribly Overwork Employee
Pro: NAME
Con: 1 Assign heavy workload and expect things to be delivered within a short of time Not because you have problem with time management it is mainly because of understaff meeting schedule too packed more work piling up everyday and work delay due to data source issues 2 Long working hour because of workload too much and need to spend extra hours to do all the unnecessary trouble shooting thanks to the poor data migration process 3 No work life balance Not only you your boss and your colleagues are all insanely hardworking Its normal to work until 34am during Weekday You thought you can take a break during Weekends Annual Leave and Sick Leave No way You are entitled with 24days annual leave but believe me you will never use it for leisure purposes 4 Nobody will care about your mental health and physical health All they care is donation and support volunteering work outside of the company So that branding can be promoted 5 High expectation from management and bosses your works will never be appreciated 6 Employee TurnOver Rate is increasing More and more people are leaving the company at least 23 people you know will be leaving every month 7 Meeting cultures are bad and some meetings are useless You will spend one whole day to attend meeting because most of the meetings last for at least 1hourand some meetings are only 10 relevant to you or for your updateknowledge sharing only 8 No time to do all those free courses no time to do team bonding no time to do small talk with your colleagues 9 Bad planning and a lot of old problems need to clear Some items have been pending for years or months but nobody do it until you take the ownership 10 People are not very helpful because they are too busy with their own work and clearing backlog When you need help the only way is to ping the person multiple times or escalate through emails cc hisher boss

Title: Join Here If You Wanna Ruin Your Life
Pro: Technology stack Learning opportunities Office infrastructure Transport facility
Con: Horrible work pressure Work life balance is a joke here Not paid proportionately freshers not IIT NIT IIM grads might earn higher than a 6 years experienced so negotiate higher initially Due to high basic tax deductions are very high thanks to our Govt as well Notice period and buyout option are probably the worst C2E LOB is probably the worst Good technology stack but you might get a chance to watch those from distance only and work in normal business logic development with vanilla coding Singapore management team is not employee focused Always tend to get a workload of 5 people get done by 2 people only that also reduce to 1 if possible Work from home was usually possible always but management never encouraged or allowed any just due to covid they were forced to allow it that too late while others already started WFH is not a boon but curse here your 9hrs of office duration gets easily stretched to 12 13 hrs usually

Title: Cares for employees

Title: Amazing People with string ethics
Pro: Wonderful people Very strong work ethics Very risk adverse high stability
Con: Not able to seize as many opportunities as riskier banks

Title: DAH2 is a great organization to start career with
Pro: Pay is better than most companies Manager and upper management supported immensely when I was going through personal issues loss of loved ones in family Good WFH options during the pandemic as I am able to do 100 of my work from home never had to go to office since the last one year Excellent increment company rewards loyal employees Work load mostly manageable Some use cases are very fun to work in analytics Good hackathon and data focus and frequent contests with rewards Free transport and coffee if you come to office reimbursable internet bills if you are working from home Good coding culture Some colleagues are brilliant in coding you can learn a lot from them Insurance policy is great got cashless claim on a surgery and it covered everything except a few antibiotics Separate flexible benefits that can be used for dental gym membership etc Was able to get WFH office setup via the extra amount provided for pandemic related expenditure CTC documents are very transparent no misleading options to inflate CTC Good gifts given by the company to employees Good training and focus on learning and development Mandatory block leave for all employees very useful to relax
Con: It is a bank so there are some restrictions on the work laptop and VPN so you dont have a lot of freedom there Deployment and release process is a bit problematic but they are working on streamlining it its much better than it was last year Sometimes have to work late or on weekends However they are trying to reduce this and provide compensatory leave if you work on a holiday

Title: Fusion between a traditional bank and a tech company
Pro: I like the culture in DBS that encourages me to do my job with integrity and give honest feedback without the worry of repercussion DBS also cares about its employees and are taking actions to improve employee life
Con: DBS is a big and complex organisation Sometimes you need to clear lots of stakeholders to get things done

Title: Great coworkers but toxic managers
Pro: Great people and challenging environment Great respect for the CEO and his vision who brought DBS to be the best bank in the world
Con: Depending in which organization you sit you might encounter toxic behaviour from management Im specifically referring to the Digital Consumer Banking Technology Big Data AI group which Im part of Its leader drives the group like a dictator often imposing questionable choices micromanaging every piece of work and showing zero respect for people who put their time and effort in designing the best possible solutions She will completely overturn decisions taken by her team and when things do not go as planned often because of decisions that she took she will start blaming people publicly yelling and screaming at everyone in meetings People are so afraid of her and worried for their job that they do not have the courage to go against her anymore This has created a toxic environment where everyone is encouraged to suck up to her and blame someone else when things do not go as planned During the course of the years I have seen her hiring very strong individuals throwing them in the garbage and forcing them to leave after few months or years just because they started disagreeing with her decisions The unfortunate thing is that the bank keeps loosing smart people just because of her toxic behaviour and her total lack of respect for any human being Work recognition is solely at her discretion and only people who has learnt to suck up to her can progress in their career

Title: Great coworkers but toxic managers
Pro: Great people and challenging environment Great respect for the CEO and his vision who brought DBS to be the best bank in the world
Con: Depending in which organization you sit you might encounter toxic behaviour from management Im specifically referring to the Digital Consumer Banking Technology Big Data AI group which Im part of Its leader drives the group like a dictator often imposing questionable choices micromanaging every piece of work and showing zero respect for people who put their time and effort in designing the best possible solutions She will completely overturn decisions taken by her team and when things do not go as planned often because of decisions that she took she will start blaming people publicly yelling and screaming at everyone in meetings People are so afraid of her and worried for their job that they do not have the courage to go against her anymore This has created a toxic environment where everyone is encouraged to suck up to her and blame someone else when things do not go as planned During the course of the years I have seen her hiring very strong individuals throwing them in the garbage and forcing them to leave after few months or years just because they started disagreeing with her decisions The unfortunate thing is that the bank keeps loosing smart people just because of her toxic behaviour and her total lack of respect for any human being Work recognition is solely at her discretion and only people who has learnt to suck up to her can progress in their career

Title: Top down approach good for retirement
Pro: Safe job good for retirement if you’re looking to stay Fixed progression and not much worry of how you’ll promote till you reach middle management Being in the corporate segment promotion is easier than the consumer segment People are generally nice politics happens but if you put departments aside general attitude is that everyone is just there as a job not to cut each other’s throats DBS definitely does have some structure and processes in place being a large Corp but has some ways to go to improve staff mindset to grow out of a domestic company culture
Con: Upper Management in SME segment are top down not responsive to feedback treats the company like an SME A lot of things are done specifically for PR purposes instead of long term vision of what is good for the customer and company Recent years have seen multiple reorgs of the IBG34 segment The working style from the top of segment is non strategic and instant gratifying Without C suite expectation of digitalization and that being put in the score card some things would not have happened Multiple projects were undertaken instead of focusing on 23 key pillars to tackle and undertake Instead of pouring dollars everywhere like over an ice cream sundae instead think of how to create the most effective means of focusing the dollars for major effect An example would be to improve internal platforms and adopt external tools like most digital banks

Title: Private Bank ARM overworked
Pro: The ARM in DBSPB does everything for the RM and ICs so you literally get insight into every single function from account opening and KYC to investment portfolio construction order taking dealing and tracking credit approval credit monitoring and review everything you can think of and cannot think of And theres also retail banking stuff credit cards cash withdrawal CNY new notes omg
Con: On the flip side you literally get paid half of the foreign banks for triple the amount of work load and if you dont get a good boss then good luck because the RM will always always always push the responsibilities and blame to the ARM

Con: Silo interaction between department Layers of regulation within and between department can be very confusing and feels disconnected All the data you need are in the system but you need to access them one by one and interpret them manually just t

Title: Think before you join Money is not everything
Pro: Good infrastructure and facility Transport facility More cash in hand Positives for some people If you are good in marketing yourselfmeans you really dont do anything but know how to show that you doing great then this is the place for
Con: No proper framework to assess the individual during appraisal People rate you based on their perception No objectivity in rating people The leadership and HR blindly believe the marketing people onlypeople who dont really work but do show off

Title: Slow paced and delusional
Pro: Such a slow pace of work that you can balance other commitments No one ever gets fired no matter how useless Singapore exposure Great office at Nariman point the view is outstanding from the higher floors and the seating is agile not fixed
Con: A lot of the HR policies are just on paper they sell them to you when you are joining Example Flexitime and Work from home In reality the managers rarely approve any of these HR is a huge team which is largely incompetent not sure which gutter they hire them from None of the HR working at DBS would be employable elsewhere The India managing committee is a mixed bag The heads of the business functions are jokers some of the support function like finance and legal are fine but marketing and HR are really substandard Singapore interferes and often creates a mess in India functioning Too many tedious unnecessary processes which slow down everything

Title: The Best Yet to Be
Pro: A very diverse regional workforce probably most diverse among some of the big local companies very strong leadership and momentum to drive shareholder values great transformation efforts many employees journey efforts great talent within the organisation growth momentum
Con: There are still some legacy mentality process thinking and even people politics which are hindering the pace of change and speed to react to the market changes Middle management is inconsistent and some staff are not as driven or could be complacent

Title: DAH 2 should be your worst case option to join
Pro: I didnt see it has any additional or unique benefits than any other product based company
Con: No work Life balance Too much micro management Not flexible in the matter of timings No work from home You better ignore joining here even though you get the best package because if you join soon youll realize what biggest mistake you made Not suitable especially for the married folks You will definitely feel that you got stuck because for your experience DAH 2 hr knows that opportunities will be less outside Thats why they prefer to recruit more experienced folks generally 7yrs Luckily I have realized early and moved out and there is no single day at DAH 2 where I went to office with a whole hearted smile Follow failfast principle to quit from here or else you will stuck forever This is from my personal experience if you still want to feel how it will be in DAH 2 Its up to you Good luck from your well wisher

Title: Dont join at all
Pro: Fancy Infra free bus free tea coffee
Con: Uncountable Initially HR will treat you as son daughter in law later they treat you like waste Dont expect any help or support you are your own The moment you put down your paper you are just like traitor for them they start treating you like enemy Work culture after few months they start realising you as you are just a slave for them you worth nothing do as they say long story short you start realizing yourself as a slave and thats truth Below manager every one is feeling same Manager is your master do as they say else be ready for consequences This is open and well known fact and policy there You are not supposed to stand for your self You are expected to work 24x7 not only expected you have to work that much time irrespective you have any emergency or personal problem it doesnt matter Manager can call you and ask you to come down at office even if you are I hospital he simply says you can go hospital later or what you are doing there doctor is the one who does

Title: Singaporean bank culture External image is changing but still decades away from foreign banks in culturecapability
Pro: Pay seems to be at market Lots of resources compared to other banks in terms of headcount per team vs foreign banks Strong retail bank and technology is improving Stable job security Relevancy as a corporate bank in Singapore Transaction banking capability is improving fast Leadership in transaction banking moving in the right direction
Con: Still has a strong Singaporean culture compared to foreign banks Learning and development from seniors is lacking Banking knowledge development is lacking ie Not developing the skillset for future roles Middle management VP to MD level likes to keep status quo Deals not as exciting as foreign banks and very short term thinking Leaders do not have the varied experiences of working for other organisations DBS whole career Hours unusually long face time Lots of disgruntled employees

Title: Great life experience A stepping stone to be in tbe customer service banking industry
Pro: The best reasons are colleagues that care to lend a helping hand when newbies does not know how to go about a new transaction That Just that
Con: Too many to mention No work life balance at all Some of the seniors are too rigid to their oldlifestyle that they never give the newbies a chance to speak up on new innovations And having no work life balance makes the body system breakdown You cant afford to take MC at all MC is not an entitlement here

Title: Feedback
Pro: Nice infrastructure if you work as a direct employee They are evolving with new Technologies
Con: Poor Project Management in development They say agile but they dont exactly follow agile Difficult understanding what people from Singapore say during requirement gathering No respect if you work as a vendor No work life balance Production Support job is very stressful They say on call and do not pay if there isnt a production Incident which means that you have to be at home waiting for SMS alert There is no shift planning in some teams and you will be called anytime by DBS Leads No work from home option because of regulatory reasons but India is not Singapore where you get MRT anytime No Google access in ODCs which means you wont be able to read Technical Stuff sometimes if you want to

Title: Good staff benefits but poor worklife balance
Pro: Decent compensation above average in terms of starting salary for fresh university graduates Good staff benefits 24 days of annual leave 2 days of family leave effectively its annual leave that you cant carry forward
Con: Poor work life balance frequent OT Almost impossible to complete ones work without doing OT on a regular basis In fact OT is like a default activity Management is overly ambitious introducing more changes and taking on more projects than the

Title: Horrible company Does not value top talent pool
Pro: Nothing to talk about Absolutely disappointing
Con: Elitist mindset Management Associates Graduate Executives get all the perks and benefits even though many of them dont make the cut Consistent top performers without career acceleration tracks are constantly undermined and underpaid even though they may be much better than the MAsGEs MAs GEs can be paid as much as an AVP with the bank for 17 years Even escalation to management and raising concerns to Human Resources on such glaring inequality results in a token few hundred dollars pay adjustment Not asking the bank to pay everyone equally but to at least ensure competitive pay for TOP performers However this seems to be too much for them as they value their MAsGEs like precious gold After working in this bank for a number of years my pay has stagnated even though I am consistently recognised as my departments top performer Record profits but no record increments or bonuses I am now leaving for greener pastures with a taste of disgust in my mouth

Title: Excellent work place
Pro: 1 Good Working environment 2 Good Infra 3 Flat organisational structure which makes it easier to interact with your colleagues and bosses ie No cubicle system 4 Best HR policies Believe me best means literally
Con: 1 The structure is based in such a way that for critical decisions also it has to go through Singapore office which mostly becomes a huge hindrance at work as all the work in pipeline get jammed 2 DBS Mumbai specifically needs deployment of innovation center as the churn rate amongst fresh graduates is high reason being the liberty to improvise on existing processes is not there yet

Title: Client Facing Role nonsales
Pro: Worklife balance optional family medical benefits annual leave 24 days and with additional childcare leave Flexicash benefit for lifestyledentalinsurance IT technology are improvised and uptodate Many systems are available to use at work which are very good compared to some banks which dont pull in resource to upgrade systems intranet information are wellequipped Other department staff are generally helpful Can find a handful of colleagues working in the bank for many years Bonus is better than EU banks and competitive with local banks
Con: Too many Management hierarchies management politics too many systems sometimes to find what you want Each teambusiness unit have their own workculture Really dependable on your direct supervisor and management to make it a joyful working environment

Title: Work life balance
Pro: Singaporean bank many singaporeans around ProAsian Work life balance present at times
Con: Use of singlishHokkiencantonesechinese is common here Feels unprofessional at times Joined straight after graduation and to hear colleagues staff who have been with the bank for 15 years and more speak languages other than english feels unprofessional In addition graduates from local uni not as competitively paid than if they were to work in foreign bank DBS is losing graduatestalent from local U fast after 23 years Many peers have left from across bank wide

Title: Think before you join Money is not everything
Pro: Good infrastructure and facility Transport facility More cash in hand Positives for some people If you are good in marketing yourselfmeans you really dont do anything but know how to show that you doing great then this is the place for
Con: No proper framework to assess the individual during appraisal People rate you based on their perception No objectivity in rating people The leadership and HR blindly believe the marketing people onlypeople who dont really work but do show off

Title: Growing Bank
Pro: DBSI is a growing company where I can expand my knowledge specially in Digital Product In addition since the integration with ANZ we experienced many challenges in our daily activities As a result we need to think creatively and effectively to overcome those challenges
Con: In my opinion with the growing company and technology DBSI should have a strong and robust standard in order to balance between customer experinece and security

Title: Great place to learn and progress
Pro: Provides good training class for new employees Although the learning curve is steep senior colleagues are all very friendly and willing to teach and guide you along the way Pay is very attractive compare to other local banks in Singapore Work culture tend to vary from different branch manager or service manager but overall they managers try to avoid work politics and lay a healthy work environment Continuous learning opportunity
Con: Long working hours People with difficulty managing time or come out with a suitable daily routine would find themselves wearing out very quickly Work with an end goal in mind

Title: ITT SG Leadership condones DAH2 senior leadership behaviour
Pro: DBS is more than family to long timers No one person can be made accountable for worsening the culture of ITT at DAH2 In the interest of well being of people it is urged that people use 360 degree feedback pigeon hole and my voice comments to get issues addressed It is not sensible to malign reputation of DBS on glassdoor If you think you are being unheard by HRBP and various forums reach out to CEO for inputs and help
Con: None that I have witnessed in last decade

Title: Great Company
Pro: 1 Bank believes strongly in talent rotation Priority is given to internal staff to apply for transfer 2 Good leaders and top management who are capable of steering the company to greater heights
Con: 1 Poor work life balance and long working hours 2 Does not pay as well compared to other banks 3 People in top positions are usually foreign talent Hires a lot of foreigners compared to Singapore Citizens

Title: DAH 2 should be your worst case option to join
Pro: I didnt see it has any additional or unique benefits than any other product based company
Con: No work Life balance Too much micro management Not flexible in the matter of timings No work from home You better ignore joining here even though you get the best package because if you join soon youll realize what biggest mistake you made Not suitable especially for the married folks You will definitely feel that you got stuck because for your experience DAH 2 hr knows that opportunities will be less outside Thats why they prefer to recruit more experienced folks generally 7yrs Luckily I have realized early and moved out and there is no single day at DAH 2 where I went to office with a whole hearted smile Follow failfast principle to quit from here or else you will stuck forever This is from my personal experience if you still want to feel how it will be in DAH 2 Its up to you Good luck from your well wisher

Title: A place for those who like to make a difference
Pro: The bank is changing for the better new breakthrough more creative ways to perform work suitable for those who wanted to contribute and make a difference The bank is growing there is a lot of opportunity and many new job created CEO and his one down are committed to practice what they preach Great place to work for woman and working mother
Con: Since the bank changing quite rapidly with more diversity understanding the way people working and their culture is crucial for survival tips in this company

Title: Decent but certainly could improve
Pro: Decent pay cab facility understanding teammates decent stack active upper management active HR teams
Con: The company is in a middle of a transition from its core old banking firm to a more technical mindset firm This transition isnt uniform some departments are way ahead in the migration than few others In respect to my department 1 Lack of challenging CS problems 2 Drastic codescope changes will require Singapore management involvement which stops you as an engineer from truly making a great product 3 Sometimes monotonous work 4 Poor timings No work from home DBS will slowly but surely transition into a proper tech company however most employees rightly so wouldnt want to wait that long

Title: Good culture mediocre benefits

Con: NAME

Title: Organisation is good place for growth
Pro: Hardwork pays off in DBS with extremely good promotion and recognition with top management including interviews with the ceo and team bonding exercises with leadership Right place to be if you want due recognition and opportunity for fast track growth
Con: Fairly new in the wealth management market DBS Bank Strategy is a bit confusing for general customer who may be looking for an all solutions provider or complete banking package DBs needs to refocus on its core competencies to outline and postion itself on a significant market share

Title: No of days leave is the most attractive

Con: Bosses like to hire the best talents either people who have obviously oversold their credentials or people whore really good in what they do but arent utilised well

Title: Good future for the bank on the outside but internal problems
Pro: Employment benefits Enthusiastic culture about things they are trying to drive Effort to open communication channels with staff straight to top management
Con: People many seniors have the dated mindset Enforcing hierarchy in management style Difficult to bring change Split locations make travelling tedious Normal working hours are beyond normal if you are a responsible employee who wont just drop your work when the minimum knockoff time is reached if work is not complete

Title: BAD
Pro: benefits are ok 24 days of annual leave etc but if you are sales staff and if your sale is bad you will not dare to take leave A good platform to jump ship
Con: Depend on the branch manager you work with Mine experience is horrifying Exboss keep screaming and shouting over some tiny matters And super Micromanage Compension is bad And keep pressing sales staff to sell certain funds or new launched products though the top mangament would say need based selling

Title: Awesome employees but worst managers in HYD
Pro: Scope to learn new technologies You can learn to work in hectic environment Good competitions for ideas and innovation with good prizes There are some good initiatives by EDs Good working hours 830am to 530pm if your manager is good
Con: Some managers VP SVP are saddist and they have very negative political mindset Hike is not as good as compared to market during annual performance cycles Some managers dont have technical skills and they dont understand the system and expect to d

Title: Political Company
Pro: Infrastructure is good as it is new setup learning and training are good cab facility is providedOnline Learning sites are good
Con: No recognition for people who really work instead awards are given to those who show off Earlier Manager shows favourtism and does not anything technical Managers at hyd cannot make any decisions and are dependent on singapore people The hyd center is vendor to singapore cost cutting has started as bonus are very lessWasting money on infrastruture and unnecessary events Initial Pay was good when joined but no good hikeMakes people move from one team to other team without considering their interest and acceptance

Title: Bank that is growing very rapidly and its growth speed brings on numerous new opportunities for the employees
Pro: Stable and overly competitive or political Improving HR benefits Coworkers are genuinely supportive and considerate Very rewarding if you have a supportive boss or if you are in the MAP
Con: limited overseas exposure or overseas posting no flexible work hours or arrangements the culture is not deep set yet can be political as many colleagues have been in DBS for more than 10 years Slow to react and difficult to implement new ide

Title: Good benefits but highly political organization
Pro: Good staff benefits and working environment Work life balance
Con: Highly political company Top leadership is clear with their direction but their one or two downs are reluctant to give direction and take accountability Often leaving working level in various department as boats heading to different directions

Title: Why DBS
Pro: A bank with a very strong balance sheet and AA credit rating Provides good platform for employees to thrive and harness their potential as it works with a startup style culture despite of being a large bank This is the largest bank in Singapore so if you are seeking employment within Singapore this is where one would want to be
Con: The banks core competence is Asia though it has international product offerings and has presence in international markets

Title: Good to work
Pro: Safe local bank to work good work life balance
Con: compensation is not good compared to other MNCs For new joiners its a struggle to learn as no documents are available or not shared by seniors No training given to new joiners and is expected to learn everything themselves Processes are not

Title: Great company to work with
Pro: They would react to the macro trend very quickly taking the initiative to improve the corporate brand They treated the staff nicely and offered a lot of training opportunities
Con: The career prospect was good for some departments but not all And they seemed to prefer recruiting readytowork talents from outside rather than grooming homemade talents which was frustrating The lower rank people had little promotion and advancement opportunities Worked overtime every single day 830am to 830pm at least but maybe it is the usual working hours for banking industry

Title: Asian Bank
Pro: Great worklife balance I always got off at 6pm sharp Above avg compensation level It used to be higher than other banks but after 2011 its expansion reduced and so does the salary
Con: There are lots of office politics probably because its an Asian bank You have to guess what others think especially what bosses are thinking about You need to be careful of using words

Title: Generous bank but management not yet there
Pro: Lots of benefits since its a big company Lots of leaves Good medical benefits Nice Colleagues Contact Centre Department to be specific
Con: Understaffed A lot of KPIs that stresses employees A lot of changes employees have to keep up in a weeklydaily basis Some of the management dont know what they are doing everything seems experimental Career progression is slow Lots of polit

Title: Good place to be in
Pro: I have left the bank but will encourage people to join DBS should opportunity arises People are generously nice there across business and support units I happened to join the right team with good managers and supportive colleagues While OT is expected in banking and especially in operation my OT hours was acceptable occasionally beyond 7pm Overall benefits are good with the most generous AL among the 3 local banks Internal transfer are widely advocated in the bank
Con: I would have stayed on if there is better bonus and increment

Title: Horrible experience did absolutely NOTHING to my career growth
Pro: Decent wage Some hardworking talented and genuinely good people
Con: NO worklife balance CRAZY workload Terribleunprofessional leadership its not what you know but WHO you know Dodges responsiblities but will not hesitate to take YOUR credit as their own when reporting to the higher authorities Very pol

Con: Very bureaucratic middle mgt below MD level slows down everything Has reputation of promoting based on length of tenure have seen dozens of very laid back individuals promoted to svp

Title: Innovation without cleaning up legacy items
Pro: Stable company good benefits
Con: Too many legacies issues Sometimes new staff is just throw into the sea to work with no guidances or guidance from people who doesnt know the whole picture this results in operational risk which ironically is what the bank is trying to minimize Most dept will just paint the good pic Bank encourage innovations but sometimes theres so many ideas from depts which are implemented that even employees are confused Employees are already tired as it is and they have to cope with new learning If you truly wan innovation clean up the legacy items first

Title: Overworked
Pro: Im still finding any after working here for 1yr
Con: DAH 2 employees are slaves for DAH employees They will give you unreasonable deadlines and will make you work over weekends in exchange for compensation off days which you will never be able to take because of the same work which made you stay in office last weekend All the managers are helpless puppets in front of DAH Singapore people

Title: CSO Senior Officer
Pro: DBS has the best perks for any employees Generous with their freebies such as random catering of the in trend snacks YOLE Ice cream etc always stocking up the pantry with food random food buffet always mindful of other religions diet etc
Con: Aggressive push for outcomes good stats Quantity over quality Best CSO are awarded based on highest number of calls instead of best quality CSATs Some CSOs has high call numbers because they constantly transfer calls that they were supposed to handle to other departments While others have lower call numbers because they answer these transferred calls

Title: Graduate Associate
Pro: As a graduate associate at the bank you will be assigned to more critical task in the department Manager will all have high expectation on you Of course this may be slightly different depends on department Therefore during interview you may want
Con: Since you are the only batch of program hire within Technology and Operation you are always assigned to a lot of ad hoc task outside your duty There is a service bond to commit if you didnt finish your programme

Title: Good benifits but Bad work culture
Pro: Cab facilityregular times extra hours at scheduled times Can claim for food bills and cab bills if you are working extra time Mostly no limit on the bills Overall good salaries and bonusbased on the project budget Training sessions and technical competitions Good looking workplace designs Helping HR teams and office staffs High end laptops to work Special focus on ladies security Lots of celebrations food festivals outing Gym bills reimbursement Indoor games TT billiards carom board etc
Con: No time limits Extend almost everyday atleast 4more hours They dont feel shy to please for work on every saturday and sunday Compoffs and leaves are just name sake Middle Management is timepass They just make work done by subordinates and submit as they work People Managers are more then technical Managers Spends plenty of money for celebrations when comes to salary hike they say budget Only one resting room for over 1000 employees If two persons sick at same time Other person to stay at his workplace or to leave home No resting and freshup facility for the staff who had to work more then 24hrs countinouslymostly on saturdays and Sunday long running CRs Impractical decisions by Management side No process and no formalities untill work goes 20 of employees works on more than one project Officially one unofficially many Somewhere people who simply impress managers can stay longer and get promotions rather than who takes responsibilities and complete work in time

Title: Backend No work life balance depressing working culture
Pro: Good staff benefits 26 days annual leave and stable company
Con: Senior management uses condescending words and threaten to put negativitve comments in appraisal as their management style when they heard not good feedback and they do not listen to explanation Do not practice open communication seniors will complain to managers when clarification and miscommunication can be avoided by just thrashing out in person Bullying by seniorscomplain to bosses instead of just facetoface clarifications and usually managers will side seniors or scared of them to be objective Shouts at new staff in public when seniors found a mistake made No worklife balance Very local culture ie Boss and seniors regardless of rank as long as they are there longer than you are always right

Title: Good learning ground for fresh grads
Pro: Good training programme especially beneficial for fresh grads Good mentorship depends on the branch you get in DBS provides you most of the necessity for you to work training mentorship sales materials even an iPad Good career progression
Con: With all the necessity provided the rest is on your own to survive the competitive sales arena In sales you dont earn more for working hard and longer hours It is best fit for the sleepless wolf A place of constant progression and contemplation a place to push yourself and hone your ability to focus to excel and to achieve consistent sales targets for the company

Title: Associate
Pro: Good Facilities Good Pay and Benefits
Con: Very long hours Toxic and political work culture Long meetings not talking about work Waste a lot of time doing presentation slides for internal meetings

Title: dbs
Pro: DBS offered the best Leave package and they do offer incentives and bonuses Allowance is given for those shifting jobs you can claim for taxi fares
Con: Very hard to get some documents at HR PC are not cleaned in technical terms whereby needed to delete old files or defrag causing it to be very slow In the last 2 years not an upgrade or pc clean was done to boost technical performance

Title: Management Associate
Pro: The MA program has really taken account of previous feedback making it a strong program for career growth Overall the people are truly a pleasure to work with and there is a genuinely positive work culture with committed mentorship from senior management Resources are also generous to encourage a learning culture whether it is providing constant training on softhard skills Much of the work is project based throughout rotations and MAs are encouraged to be innovative People who are proactive and display PRIDE values will thrive and be recognised for sure
Con: None that comes to mind

Title: Terrific Culture
Pro: new technologiesDecent payTransportationpartiesindependent taskEdge Technologies

Title: Technology Teams is a big mess among teams

Title: Senior Management are active and committed to the growth of the bank

Con: Staff welfare benefits can be improved Middle management may not be as committed Somewhat conservative work culture

Title: You need to mix with the right people
