Title: Bad senior management in ITT bu
Pro: Good bank with good vision
Con: Initial days we talk to platform leadslater on senior management also started engaging themselves in each and every activities Feels like micro manage us Also different platforms we hear them What ever they speak in one meeting its completely opposite in other meeting Sometimes he engages with less productive work He thinks he is the only Person know everything rest all doesnt know anything With this behaviour we feel inferior and demotivated

Title: Good to work
Pro: Safe local bank to work good work life balance
Con: compensation is not good compared to other MNCs For new joiners its a struggle to learn as no documents are available or not shared by seniors No training given to new joiners and is expected to learn everything themselves Processes are not

Title: Great company to work with
Pro: They would react to the macro trend very quickly taking the initiative to improve the corporate brand They treated the staff nicely and offered a lot of training opportunities
Con: The career prospect was good for some departments but not all And they seemed to prefer recruiting readytowork talents from outside rather than grooming homemade talents which was frustrating The lower rank people had little promotion and advancement opportunities Worked overtime every single day 830am to 830pm at least but maybe it is the usual working hours for banking industry

Title: About company culture
Pro: Good company and Good culture
Con: One of the most faltu hiring practice in the company The hiring leads and a few of his colleagues are involved in big scam of hiring through agencies by taking big amount for processing their candidates They already earned in lakhs of rupees and there is no control on the scam I joined technology team with lot of respect to the organisationIf this practice continues without stopping all reputation build by company will be destroyed Iam not sure how company can have such people in the hiring team Some candidates directly approached during drives for money I hope management will take action the team

Title: Bancassurance Specialist
Pro: The benefits are good The number of annual leave is great There is the companys club that gives special deals for leisure You get good rates if you want to get a loan
Con: Absolutely no work life balance Colleagues are not exactly friendly Lots of regulations to abide and be cautious of

Title: It pays to be a cog
Pro: I liked the role primarily because it paid well Other compensation benefits were also adequate and matched my expectations even slightly exceeding it
Con: It was too structured perhaps to a fault The hierarchy was intensive leaving no flexibility in terms of innovating This really changed the experience from a positive one to a neutral one

Title: DBS Bank
Pro: Passionate Relationship Led Integrity Focused Dedicated to Teamwork Excelling with Confidence Good management level with clear strategic goals makes this bank one of the best in region
Con: Especially for the technology departments I wouldnt advice as there is a huge proportion of contracted employees through vendors To become perm they are working unnecessary more hours giving away the worklife balance and this creates an unfair competition for perm employees

Title: TS
Pro: Very chill friendly and everyone is willing to teach you I was able to learn a lot since my supervisor assigned me to different desks sometimes when I done with work early Training is definitely very structured and outstanding in DBS and working environment is very good
Con: Sometimes the work can get boring but really depends on which department you are in and what type of work you are interested

Title: work for 3yrs
Pro: good benefits good welfare people are generally nice on the surface
Con: quite political hierarchical must suck it up to bosses to make it progression depends on tenure in bank rather than whether your performance is good or not at least for my department worklife balance is quite tough as the work load keeps piling up very quickly

Title: Awesome employees but worst managers in HYD
Pro: Scope to learn new technologies You can learn to work in hectic environment Good competitions for ideas and innovation with good prizes There are some good initiatives by EDs Good working hours 830am to 530pm if your manager is good
Con: Some managers VP SVP are saddist and they have very negative political mindset Hike is not as good as compared to market during annual performance cycles Some managers dont have technical skills and they dont understand the system and expect to d

Title: Having worked in multiple SME and also government jobs prior to DBS this is the best the best you can get
Pro: Employee Benefits especially annual leave Supportive colleagues from within the same teamdepartment
Con: Long hours especially for those working in BO Projects that require cross departmentunit efforts may face challenges especially when those departmentsunits are just supporting the project rather than leading them Processes can be very confusing for new joiner

Title: Nice people nice company nice experience
Pro: very nice colleagues would like to get everyone involved and treat everyone well Can learn a lot from people The bank is also trying to offer a lot of opportunities to its people Very impressive corporate culture
Con: Limited to Asian not many internationals here Cantonese is the basic communication language among people

Title: Political Company
Pro: Infrastructure is good as it is new setup learning and training are good cab facility is providedOnline Learning sites are good
Con: No recognition for people who really work instead awards are given to those who show off Earlier Manager shows favourtism and does not anything technical Managers at hyd cannot make any decisions and are dependent on singapore people The hyd center is vendor to singapore cost cutting has started as bonus are very lessWasting money on infrastruture and unnecessary events Initial Pay was good when joined but no good hikeMakes people move from one team to other team without considering their interest and acceptance

Title: Best Company to work learn grow and excel
Pro: 1 Best work culture and practices 2 Honestly saying Job Satisfaction is close to 100 3 Strong Performance in the market so No need to fear about jobloss
Con: 1 Sometimes work is stressful

Title: Decent place to start out
Pro: Friendly working environment The hierarchy is quite flat and the superiors are approachable and do value your feedback and inputs
Con: Compensation could be more competitive given its strategy to expand across Asia more could be done to retain and recruit talent

Title: Not a bad place if you want a stable job
Pro: Good bonus good trainings available generally friendly culture
Con: Strategy not aligned among different departments not very innovative every departments need to be working together to achieve common goal therefore KPI across departments have to be aligned middle management needs to be trained more how to lead their teams

Title: I worked in the consumer investment and insurance products group in the commercial bank as a summer analyst
Pro: Great mentorship there from everyone in the team Alot of opportunities to interact with senior management Wide variety of work to do although not very challenging
Con: Easy and mundane work due to it being commercial banking They hire 95 from the local universities which makes it a very stagnant culture Lack of opportunities to get fulltime employment

Title: Boss is bigger than anything
Pro: Pay well stable job company making profit If you can survive and know how to handle your boss a good place for retirement
Con: No enough resource and time to do right work Instead of doing your professional job struggling on pressure from boss and boss boss Not professional in most cases more time spend on ppt than real work Have to hide issue instead work on it Compare with other banks over secured IT reduce efficiency and confuses all newbies The security team obviously dont know how to play with MAS

Title: DAH2 Hyderabad a Great Place to Learn
Pro: High technology focus get to learn and work on new age tech stacks Good senior leadership Great learning development practices
Con: India Singapore relationship is not good India managers dont have too much control on how work is allocated

Title: An integrated Asian experience with growth opportunities in Abundance
Pro: Stable Well Capitalized Focussed Strategy Expanding provides ample growth oppurtunities Work life balance Regional dominance Diverse Businesses Diverse Work force
Con: Interdepartmental cohesion not at its best Outdated processes systems focussed on short term solutions Overall compensation as compared to European counterparts

Title: Global Transaction Service
Pro: The employees here are all talent in GTS besides the interior design is very comfortable Its a good place to stay
Con: The choices of the restaurant is not enough near DBS because its in Xinyi district all of the foods there are very expensive

Title: DBS is considered one of the safest banks globally and has a strong presence in Asia
Pro: Good work life balance with competitive benefits Strong management who consider inputs from all employees Has been consistently improving in terms of profitability
Con: Base salaries are not as competitive as other foreign banks hence it is not able to attract as many talents However overall package is still competitive

Title: A performance driven work environment with strong emphasis on digifying processes with pretty good staff benefits
Pro: Clear KPIs set out has strong customer base and staff empowerment Remuneration is competitive as compared to industry and staff benefits are good
Con: Fully sales based and slightly longer hours in business unit No time to partake in part time further studies Efforts to captureretain market share is very strong

Title: Worst company to Work
Pro: Cab facility good package for new joinees best company for lead or above role because 95 people of these roles do not work Good for people who are good event organizers and maintain rapo with management
Con: Worst company most of the lead or above roles do not add any value to the company and these people are very good at playing politics Lot of favoritism while giving promotions providing opportunities appraisal People wgo are really working hard for the company are treated as slaves and not considered for appraisal People who maintaibs good rapo with management or hr they get good ratings promotions and organization level awards While announcing awards by hr people to specific management puppets while hearing the reason employees use to laugh

Title: Good exposure great mentorship
Pro: Best bank in the world what more is there to say
Con: At times you wish you could put in a little more hours spend a little more time with your financial model and build stronger bonds with your colleagues in the team the bank has an emphasis on work life balance and spending more time with family is actively encouraged

Title: Many good colleagues but also fair share of terrible ones
Pro: Crossdepartmentbusiness line collaboration isnt as painful as in some other banks Five on Five policy for Fridays is good plus staff cafeteria with a bay view
Con: They do tolerate some really verbally abusive managers for quite a while And some senior guys who disappear for hours on end and dont show up for meetings

Title: Good CoWorkers
Pro: CoWorkers are great Reporting manager was super helpful Lots of learning opportunities
Con: Long work hours Terrible upper management People go with hierarchy

Title: DBS Summer Analyst Review
Pro: Great mentorship from senior level members Friendly environment especially for interns who need help learning Afterduring work social bonding ie getting drinks with coworkers going for lunchdinner
Con: Hard to interact with other interns there could be more social events to network with them There is no postinternship job offers that are given to my knowledge which is discouraging

Title: Eye opening experience Processes are much more convulated than you can imagine
Pro: It has great culture and environment The people here are very friendly and helpful There is also good corporate identity
Con: Compensation is pathetic and perhaps even humiliating If not so for senior positions it is so for junior positions Fresh graduates get 30 less from DBS than from other banks

Title: A fast paced bank but dont ever miss hitting your quarterly budget
Pro: U learn a lot and colleagues and systems are dynamic
Con: Immediate boss bends backward and forward Staff end up feeling disgruntled and many senior guys had left The bank itself has also become too big and too bureaucratic The environment has turned political and driven solely by numbers

Title: Strong vision and leadership team
Pro: The bank has a very clear vision and strategic priorities to achieve its digital transformation and sustainability agenda CEO and leadership team cascade this message and continuously engage employees to ensure alignment and a strong sense of purpose Incredibly fast paced but a great place for someone who wants to learn work on exciting projects and stay ahead of the curve
Con: The company is changing rapidly and this may be uncomfortable for some For those new to the organisation theres a need to adapt to contribute effectively

Title: Digital Bank to the Core
Pro: DBS invest in some of the most cutting edge technologies enabling its employee to work digitally The iFlex benefit and iTime policy also enables us to take full control of our benefit and working schedule
Con: As all transforming companies people need to catch up with the technology being introduced and need to learn to work with technology sadly not everyone is catching up fast enough

Title: Good but can be better
Pro: Friendly people willing to teach and share bank is doing well with good future prospects as of 2013
Con: Frequently have to travel between offices which can be annoying and timeconsuming doesnt seem to have much worklife balance

Title: Surveys are filled by managers and leads Micromanagement at its peak No anonymity
Pro: Not applicable Nothing new Working on 10 years old tech stack
Con: Most of people work in DBS are either tired or they just want to save their job They dont ask questions to anyone Recently anonymous survey link was given to all employees and all manager leads sat near to each employee and filled themselves Thats how DBS works When I talked to HR about this survey problem they told that talk to your manager Its between you and your manager Dont ever join this organization

Title: Senior Service Executive
Pro: its a learning path process good benefits for staff pay increment and high bonus paid depends on performance
Con: Office politics exist everyday cross sell insurance product for service staff with target 68 per month no life balance as your off day will be canceled if it is lack of manpower no overtime pay for rank BEB and above

Title: DAH2 C2Epolitical hotbed managed by narcissism undemocratic autocracy rule
Pro: You can learn politics easily here and how to adopt to yes boss culture
Con: The C2E department is worst managed by rule of rod There is no democratic process Those who have to manage department culture are playing with junior career Just concluded piegonhole survey and answers are cryptic with no regard to high standard of DBS organization The department is run as private property of few HIPPO people who enjoy absolute power

Title: Not as prestigious as you might think
Pro: 1 Youre working in the worlds best bank 2 You can call yourself a banker 3 Staff benefits are terrific
Con: Wow Where do I start If youre joining as a Wealth Planning Manager and believe that youre getting a prestigious job particularly after those IQ tests they put you through online youre drinking the koolaid Anyone with half the average IQ can get in If youre holding a good university degree please dont waste your time and seek better professions elsewhere In this role there are only two things you can do day in and day out Cold call people and convince them to purchase insurance products If youre not an insurance specialist you get the added privilege of selling housing loans and unit trusts Dont kid yourself with the idea that youre helping people 99 of WPMs are doing it for the commission so do ahead and employ dirty tricks to get that money Dont quote me on this Management is a hit or miss depending on where you are deployed to Managers are former top sales WPMs Thats the only criteria aside from having your boss favour you Youre blessed if you have any form of capable mentorship to help you excel at your role Expect long work hours coldcalling people Does not stimulate me That said depending on your colleagues around you work environment is fantastic Expect some sexism homophobia and racial ignorance but thats pretty typical Backend operations is completely incompetent Try to get in touch with any operation support team and face a dead end Lack of seamless communication within their own internal structure makes processes more complicated than they should be If you are keen on joining think hard and long about the career path you wish to attain Ensure that you have a transferable skillset should you opt out of bankinginsurance sales or stay on and hope you make it to management Even after all that I have said the possible career progression is still decent

Title: Other than this year bonus and increment Ive been happy so far
Pro: Loan preferential rate savings interest preferential rate banking privilege share option S1000 maternity benefits upon delivering
Con: no guaranteed 13th month little bonus little increment rigid internal system process messy technical approval system for IT line

Title: Life in DBS
Pro: Established local bank with growing reputation in Asia region Strong Asian culture and value Provide employees with courses to enrich themselves further Good benefits such as high number of leaves and medical coverage
Con: While certain jobs allow worklife balance some jobs require OT till very late almost daily Pay wise is acceptable as a local bank but considerably low as compared with prestigious foreign banks

Title: Okay at first then slowly became frustrating
Pro: Decent Benefits Monthly remuneration on the low side Other benefits such as employee share option scheme make up for it However you have to work longer than a year to enjoy such benefits Decent work life balance
Con: Conservative mindset that impedes learning and career advancement Biased employee engagement survey results

Title: Deceiving company
Pro: Pretty good benefits Nice pantry and the physical environment is pretty modern and technologically updated Building looks nice Security is quite topnotch Bank takes care to protect customers details
Con: Unable to utilise benefitsleave subject to approval demanding supervisors colleagues are those who will stab you behind your back Keeps changing policies HR spews propaganda but in reality working environment is not that great

Title: Need to be politically savvy not much recognition for talent Politics takes priority over talent
Pro: Good Salary and benefits Good brand to work for
Con: Lacks in technology Strategy Though employee benefits are good employee welfare is not a priority Very superficial Training not in line with role performed

Title: Customer Service Officer at Call Center Department 6 months plus 010 Do not recommend
Pro: Benefits are good 24 days AL 2 day family care leave 30 days medical leave Colleagues are very nice people they will go extra to help out
Con: 1 Applying for leave at the call center department is very difficult and there is an unwritten rule that it is frowned upon Managers will write people up for even taking sick leave which is unethical and ridiculous 2 Most team managers only cares about meeting their own metrices they dont care about the well being of their reports If you are lucky you will get assigned to a good TM otherwise your time there will be frustrating 3 If you do overtime it will be compensated as off in lieu The catch is that it is so hard to get off you might as well give them free OT There are people trying to utilize their off in lieu for months but their requests are rejected with dumb reasons such as not able to take post shift off for pm shifts 4 Same problem for the rest of your leave Birthday time off etc since it is next to impossible to get them 5 Systems are unreliable and will fail at least 2 times every month but you are expected to get on without them The back up system is useless and you cant access the important files in the intranet you need for references Any mistakes that you make even when systems are down is on you and will become part of your performance report 6 You will deal with difficult people every day It is what the company is paying you for Not recommended for the fainthearted Get ready to spend thousands on therapy

Title: Too much politics and marketing at Senior Level
Pro: Trainings on new technologytransport is free and goodwaverock building is new
Con: Bad leaders and much of work politics regional playoutside hyderabad people are working hard and rewards going to local people I joined consumer banking to learn payments but learning just how to code UI and impress SG people with POC Everything said by SG is followed by local people Feedback is by SG managers and local managers just nod Blindly follows SG people Survey is filled but when I fill own I get blacklist by manager It is better to give top score

Title: Decent benefits and salary for an entry level position
Pro: I came in through one of their graduate programs The salary and benefits are competitive to that of the market
Con: Though Im in a grad program there is little to none centralised training which was different from the impression I got before I came in

Title: Blend of East and West Cultures
Pro: Loads of clientele Micromanagement kept to a moderate level Entire bank has a singular purpose and clarity in its goals and objectives
Con: Compensation is on the lower end in the industry Technology is outdated but slowly improving

Title: Great working environment and culture but progression is slow
Pro: • friendly and helpful colleagues • good working environment • flexible work hours • shuttle buses provided • good employee welfare and benefits
Con: • work progression is very slow • have to work at least 34 years before promotion • high volume of work • hires the wrong people for the job

Title: Branch Business Manager
Pro: If you get a good BBM your days at work is heavenly even tho it’s a sales role
Con: If you get a bad BBM then best is if you resign and find something better

Title: In the midst of having my internship there Would say I like the culture of the good My department has lots of activities for bonding My colleagues are nice too
Pro: Can knock off early on Friday 5pm But this varies among departments and among of workload you have
Con: Havent experience anything bad So far so good

Title: Deserves only 2 stars 1 for facilities 1 for pay
Pro: Good facilities cab encashment for medical expenses
Con: No work life balance lot of pressure onsite counterparts say to complete the task by eod however complex it might no proper management non cooperative managers and leads no team bonding activities no fun at work no encourage for sports no proper ETA hurry in deliveries fail in prod lot of rework nature nothing to learn new worst technically lmplemented projects

Title: INSURANCE SPECIALIST
Pro: Extremely good system well remunerated Easy to do business with strong business support Encouraging managers good working environment Upward progression is fast and possible Eg Insurance Specialist to RM and RM to Manager
Con: extremely long hours internal career change to other departments eg Sales to Marketingmight be tougher due to the large number of candidates who already have prior experience on the role

Title: Good place to start off you banking career
Pro: Solid training programs to build your foundation Great people willing to help one another mostly Fortunate to meet a good boss that taught me alot
Con: Can be rather strict and rather by the book at times Pay and comms are not that fantastic when compared to other banks but at least its constant

Title: Good time good experiences
Pro: Nice office good environment not much difference between intern and permanent staffs Decent pay slightly above market average for intern I was involved in many aspects and had quite alot of experiences although the workload is quite high
Con: NAME

Title: Great place to work
Pro: Good bonding between colleagues Not too bad bonus Predictable working hours 21 days annual leaves Good employee benefit
Con: Diversity is not great Brand name is not very strong People work in an unstructured way which could be improved

Title: Overall good
Pro: Fantastic ambience work culture and decent pay CoOperative superiors Employee friendly Good process for continually educating employees
Con: Too many changes in the management No set processes not very flexible in terms of customer service No new products or good products

Title: Bank Executive
Pro: Best bonus structure Salary very competitive Company focuses on employee empowerment and engagement Company very innovative
Con: The very traditional work ethics of colleagues who have been with the bank for over 20 years

Title: On the right track but need to be a lot clearer
Pro: Great benefits treats staff very well there is a semblance of work life balance great colleagues all around
Con: Senior management has no idea what to do with the direction Sets a KPI for a while then changes another direction completely

Title: Nice working place
Pro: An open environment with kind colleagues and pleasant atmosphere It is exciting to see and learn from hardworking seniors The connection between global branches is solid and the problemsolving efficiency is accordingly high
Con: Personal growth is limited as a contractor Trivial things are not in a small amount and quite annoying sometimes but those process are somehow necessary

Title: Innovation without cleaning up legacy items
Pro: Stable company good benefits
Con: Too many legacies issues Sometimes new staff is just throw into the sea to work with no guidances or guidance from people who doesnt know the whole picture this results in operational risk which ironically is what the bank is trying to minimize Most dept will just paint the good pic Bank encourage innovations but sometimes theres so many ideas from depts which are implemented that even employees are confused Employees are already tired as it is and they have to cope with new learning If you truly wan innovation clean up the legacy items first

Title: Great learning experiences openness and action oriented
Pro: Leadership learning from colleagues learning opportunities working on latest technologies openness to feedback clear attempts to action on feedback
Con: work planning recognising individuals for good work

Title: DBS leads the way in the global financial race
Pro: Good compensation motivated coworkers ASEAN leader racing towards global influence mobility results
Con: Competitive spirit could been seen as intimidating to those not motivated towards success

Title: A bank with a fintech dream
Pro: Systematic training Technology vision and focus Innovation endeavors Keeping up with the digital trend
Con: Very messy resources planning Country senior management controls like monarchy his henchmen manipulated all evaluation and decisions while treating other staff like his slavea HR sucks HR does anything but helpful

Title: DBS Bank as a full time sales staff
Pro: if you get a good boss you have work life balance good internal mobility processes but I feel it constraints you to similar or related roles only
Con: HR sides the bosses not you Hiring too may exUOB bosses and bringing over the bad culture too much red tape

Title: Sales
Pro: Competitive salary package in the organization great working environment and friendly team Good welfare and working hours for employees
Con: Nothing negative about it Its a local bank with international ambitions It expanded very quickly

Title: Good
Pro: Good culture though dependent on the team and unit you are in Can be well paid and there is a culture of moving people around to grow them Stable business and employer
Con: Some teams can have an international mindset but there is still not enough cultural diversity outside of the top ranks Bureacractic though perhaps that is true of all large banks

Title: Challenging in both good and bad ways
Pro: You will be stretched to do new things Its very performance and outcome driven so there is pressure but increasingly encouraging a fail better learning environment and culture
Con: Traditional hierarchy style of management Politics abound and you may not be able to get things done as directly as they should be Some managers are still abusive in the way they talk

Title: Bancassurance Specialist
Pro: Many benefits eg medical holiday claims etc excellent colleagues and superiors Lots of events corporate or personal to mingle with your colleagues and superiors
Con: Can get a little stressful when you do not hit your target Definitely not a 9 to 5 job More like 8 to 8

Title: Flexible org but very less growth opportunities
Pro: Office is colourful vibrant Flexible teams Approachable management
Con: Managers are partial and if you good repo with them you will get good projects and better opportunities No onsite not even short term

Title: Not great
Pro: Convenient shifts for a student and lots of opportunities to learn about products
Con: The manager in general My interview questions were answered for me because the manager decided I look the part Honestly have no idea how someone so incompetent has managed to maintain a role as a manager for so long whilst making so many inappropriate remarks

Title: Mixed feeling
Pro: The pay is good the leave is good the medical benefits are excellent Monetary wise a perfect company Good reputation Great for stepping stone
Con: Contact Centre has high attrition rate than normal in 2013 due to a change in management Appraisal was hardly fair Doubt any attempt to try to be fair in the department Performance framework is well developed but it is often abused

Title: Working enviroment
Pro: Familylike working environment despite the difference in posts the hierarchy rarely matters The staffs have no qualms helping on another despite their workload as well
Con: In the working environment the job can be rather monotonous at times and there isnt much learning that could be done

Title: Very regimental and systematical
Pro: Good staff benefits and frequent engagement of staff in events Work a lot with foreigners in a fast paced environment
Con: Very regimental where numbers are very important and in most cases illogical People do not question the management despite the illogical decisions sometimes Feels like I am working with robots and machine

Title: IT Professional Suicide Everything is FAKE
Pro: Good Salary Stable Good WorkMates If you are used to do nothing this is your place If you love copy paste from a web to a excel to an email this is your place
Con: Everything about DBS Technology is false Pure propaganda nothing is real The job descriptions are absolutely misleading to hunt talent and waste it you may be applying for a specific position but you will be doing something totally different and irrelevant DBS is stuck in the 90s IBM ways and achieve technology goals is barely impossible perform basic tasks can take you months of bureaucracy Terrible monitoring and alerting fully surrounded of old fashion technologies 999 just Java not much room for improvement No Docker No Python No Go No real Cloud No IaaC No Labs as LOBs are totally decoupled from TS who controls everything and do nothing The offices are the worst environment ive worked so far in my 15 years of career to a point that I had daily skin rashes you can walk around and see desks or rugs not cleaned in one year a real shame for a bank that waste so much money in unnecessary proprietary software but cut costs in keeping clean the work environments DBS is under a transformation which Is mainly about rename teams to trend labels the tasks stills oldfashion and obsolete They talk too much about Agile and DataDriven but the only thing of Agile that this organization do is avoid documentation at all I could not fit in this organization and decided to left because the position was like everything else in this place fake

Title: Long time employees are DBS worst enemy
Pro: Stable well paid job subordinates never challenges whats being said and done
Con: Politics is everything performance or technical knowledge has no value at all in managements eyes Long timers hide information from newbies or even make fun of them just to slow down their work Middle managers are not experienced enough to know what is important so they are easily fooled by people with the loudest voice Talanted people usually leave the company rather quick

Title: You need to explore your 25th hour in a day to balance worklife
Pro: Need to dig a lot to find Pros
Con: No Employee friendly Culture No Personal Life Work Life Balance You MUST be available 24 X 7 366 days even in nonleap year Leadership definition of Agile is Micro management Dead lines asking status of work every 15 mins Pick 200 work deliver all No open feedback culture PTO Page Turn Over Refer to Next section please if you need more

Title: Architect
Pro: Challenging environment A good place to exercise a lot of creativity
Con: A lot of process Could spend a lot of time trying to figure out how to work the process than real work

Title: Great Organization
Pro: Great CEO people are nice and yet focused on business objectives Supportive of staff development Exciting times to be in the bank now as it embark on its transformation
Con: generally you will need to be able to keep up with the pace of changeand also to be able to multi task

Title: Assistant VIce President Fixed Income
Pro: 1 Flexibility to move to different departments within the bank 2 The management gives sufficient incubation time for new businesses
Con: 1 Pay rank parity is not great even at the time of lateral hiring 2 Salary hikes seem to be linked to Singapore inflation even in high inflation countries

Title: Good experience nothing much to expect due to local culture
Pro: Share Ownership Scheme plan is great if you are looking to just stay there Benefits in general are good too Family friendly
Con: Hierarchy based promotion very rigid and qualification based Management has a slight bias when choosing promotees and doesn’t promote competition

Title: Associate
Pro: Good Facilities Good Pay and Benefits
Con: Very long hours Toxic and political work culture Long meetings not talking about work Waste a lot of time doing presentation slides for internal meetings

Title: Great Place to Work in India
Pro: 1 Work Life balance of employees is Great 2 Sr Management Managers are easily reachable even for the team member is lowest hierarchy 3 DBS Cares The bank has best HR policy It recurits retains and rewards the team members well
Con: There are no cons here

Title: A good design team and culture
Pro: The design team culture and work is good The key managers are good and invested in your growth The team is open to innovating the way they work You are expected to take ownership and drive key results and outcomes Overall its a goo
Con: The process though changing is a little slow

Title: Good worklife balance
Pro: Good worklife balance and plenty of perks family day employee benefits
Con: Mid level management is not progressive and is not willing to risk for the fear of repercussion Some projects are done for the sake of showing senior management that work is done with no actual improvement or benefits

Title: Poor midmanagement great culture
Pro: Familystyle of employment without job loss concerns Desire to innovate and progress
Con: Old guard are generally incompetent shout and bully Old guard not moved on and not a meritocracy

Title: Innovative yet very political winner
Pro: Very innovative vast opportunities to participate in strategic change the bank initiatives CEO is on a roll to deliver record breaking results quarter upon quarter
Con: Extremely siloed and political environment Although salaries are on par with the industry benefits arent

Title: Bank with strong digital ambition
Pro: DBS takes care of their employees like any other bank The bank has a strong outlook in terms of growth
Con: Might be too one dimensional with sales focus but end of the day in sales its a numbers game Very local work environment will need some adjust for nonlocals to work there

Title: dbs
Pro: DBS offered the best Leave package and they do offer incentives and bonuses Allowance is given for those shifting jobs you can claim for taxi fares
Con: Very hard to get some documents at HR PC are not cleaned in technical terms whereby needed to delete old files or defrag causing it to be very slow In the last 2 years not an upgrade or pc clean was done to boost technical performance

Title: Deloitte First job
Pro: Fun people and lots of activities for team bonding Superiors are well trained and will be willing to give you feedback
Con: Lots of work to do and the leaving rate is extremely high Peers can be competitive sometimes

Title: Good place to work and grow But no work life balance
Pro: Fast growing Hence many opportunities Very good place to learn and grow in your career if that’s your primary objective
Con: V Demanding work culture So no work life balance Salary and compensation not so good but average as pet the market

Title: Transparency in Policy
Pro: DBS Bank Ltd a Very good company to work across banking
Con: Too much micromanagement and there is always a difference in what had been told and what is followed is respective to India operations

Title: High Paced Environment
Pro: Premier Bank in Asia with a fairly organized training program for summer interns Patient and friendly supervisors that work with even the most inexperienced interns
Con: As a foreigner I felt somewhat alienated from the close knit almost strictly Singaporean coworkers Didnt develop as tight of relationships as I would have liked

Title: Working in DBS
Pro: Progressive ability to execute to strategy which shows in the financial results strong CEO many fun activities
Con: Hours can be long depending on which department you work in IT systems although improving can be better

Title: VP IBG
Pro: PRIDE Purposedriven Relationshipled Innovative Decisive and Everything Fun By demonstrating these core values DBS hope to lead by example And in sharing DBS knowledge and experience shape the next generation of leaders in the banking services industry
Con: SILO reporting creates silo between departments

Title: Associate
Pro: Many opportunities and allow internal transfer under 22 programme
Con: A lot of challenges if your work requires you to deal with IT enhancements which is getting more and more common here such as endless meetings as the stakeholders are in Changi office or India long working hours require to do system testing etc

Title: Customer Service Officer
Pro: Environment to work at was filled with friendly and helpful people
Con: Although most people are helpful there are some team managers who are unhelpful and would just say that they are busy Or they cannot be found at their desk when they are the only TM on duty on that shift

Title: Best infra and best policies
Pro: Infrastructure Policies expertise of Management Flat hierarchy Easy to approach anyone HR or Management Appreciation for good work Helpful Staff Non technical
Con: Little work life balance issues due to totally new setup but that is ok as the company is growing It will get better

Title: Worked at Toh Guan office
Pro: NAME
Con: Lots of veterans as colleagues not convenient location if miss shuttle bus service need to walk at least 15 mins from MRT but if you like walking good for you

Title: FTBA
Pro: Above average salary for entry level sales Competitive employee benefits Famous brand in Asia region
Con: Redundant company policies and operating procedures No worklife balance The brand is famous in Asia region but not in Taiwan Most superior executives only concern about the sales performance and always look for opportunity to transfer to other bank The company policies tend to shirk off the responsibilities to low level employees by asking the employees to sign a lot of agreements Slow in catching up the trend and Fintech literally no innovation

Title: Confusing
Pro: Good brand names Many perks
Con: Many transition going on where policies owners are changed Sometimes new policy owners or their staff does not have much ideas about the new portfolio they are having which makes it difficult to get things done Too many changes and very disruptive

Title: Room for improvement
Pro: Stable local bank that needs no introduction I was lucky to be promoted quite fast during my term with the bank Had good bosses I guess
Con: Extremely high volume because of the number of clients in DBS hence resulting in long hours HR has a habit of putting a quota on the number of people to be promoted so its not entirely based on your merits

Title: Ever growing in strength and leading the pack
Pro: Solid culture and management that is enabling the whole organisation and participants to be led in clear manner We have confidence and clarity from top management of where the bank is heading
Con: Too many systems downtimes productivity concerns such that customer experienced are still found wanting by many users and also by staff Understaffed in some branches

Title: Nice Place with Learning Opportunities and Smart People

Title: It pays to be a cog

Con: It was too structured perhaps to a fault The hierarchy was intensive leaving no flexibility in terms of innovating This really changed the experience from a positive one to a neutral one

Title: DBS Bank
Pro: Passionate Relationship Led Integrity Focused Dedicated to Teamwork Excelling with Confidence Good management level with clear strategic goals makes this bank one of the best in region

Title: Have a Strong Mind

Con: If youre not good with time management cases will just pile up and youll get new cases daily too Depending on how you deal with stress and management the workload will drown you Phones ring nonstop Youre going to be told off by nasty customers almost everyday Liaising with other business units for follow up replies is tedious KPI updated hourly so it depends on how you take it Every second plays into your KPI how fast you answer the call the actual call time after call time personal break only 10 mins a day and every secondminute that exceeds your break Very steep learning curve especially when youre on more splits than your seniors If youre on chat prepare for concurrent chats Customers be it on chat or phone are usually there to complain or demand for something ridiculous When cases are escalated managers tend to give in to them which made whatever you initially told customers REDUNDANT because you could have done it yourself but no not according to terms and conditions As they develop apps campaigns and platforms frequently there are always new issues Turnover rate is high and with good reason understaffed high MC rates thus more workload for everyone else Moving to another department is only if youve been there 2 years and are a top performer So if your stats arent great its a waste

Title: Customer Service Officer at Call Center Department 6 months plus 010 Do not recommend
Pro: Benefits are good 24 days AL 2 day family care leave 30 days medical leave Colleagues are very nice people they will go extra to help out
Con: 1 Applying for leave at the call center department is very difficult and there is an unwritten rule that it is frowned upon Managers will write people up for even taking sick leave which is unethical and ridiculous 2 Most team managers only cares about meeting their own metrices they dont care about the well being of their reports If you are lucky you will get assigned to a good TM otherwise your time there will be frustrating 3 If you do overtime it will be compensated as off in lieu The catch is that it is so hard to get off you might as well give them free OT There are people trying to utilize their off in lieu for months but their requests are rejected with dumb reasons such as not able to take post shift off for pm shifts 4 Same problem for the rest of your leave Birthday time off etc since it is next to impossible to get them 5 Systems are unreliable and will fail at least 2 times every month but you are expected to get on without them The back up system is useless and you cant access the important files in the intranet you need for references Any mistakes that you make even when systems are down is on you and will become part of your performance report 6 You will deal with difficult people every day It is what the company is paying you for Not recommended for the fainthearted Get ready to spend thousands on therapy

Title: horrible
Pro: people generally are nice but seems standoffish due to the culture Top management and CEO seems to have good view and values as to the direction of the bank
Con: most banks have many systems to toggle between for BAU but it is my honest opinion that DBS takes the crown for the most number of system that serves at most 2 purpose each i need 17 systems for bau all on a 15 inch laptop strong top management weak mid management and unbalance ground staff initiatives from top management makes sense and seems genuine in creating a good workplace and dependable bank however mid management either lack that foresight or are too busy in proving themselves that initiatives being cascaded down with very little effort in thoughts for the people on the ground a team setup for a certain purpose is quickly overlooked about its objectives and overloaded due to poor management and planning too many grey areas archaic processes and systems management too concern with pushing issues away and hover along the grey areas rather than embrace changes and acknowledge that its for the greater good to see every department as 1 bank rather than separate units mid management are too busy with proving themselves and giving results with no concern to staff they take everything on and just throw it downwards with no deep understanding on how they want things to work they only want to see the end results when feedback on said issues they only know how to ask for numbers and stats extremely narrow minded lots of trainings and lofty ideas but none ive attended shows true reflection of management understanding what the real life is on the ground when issues are brought up during trainings trainers shrug and say speak to your manager when you speak to your manager they tell you not to get them in trouble sure CEO had invited people to contact him directly but how many people are willing to disregard their livelihood and perhaps managers with good working relationships and contact the CEO directly
